sentences.english: Mandy, Mr. Dwyer’s grandfather invented the Yellow Pages.
sentences.chinese: 曼迪，德維爾先生的祖父發明了黃頁。

sentences.english: Ultratech to learn how to "do" research " from " the pages of the city.
sentences.chinese: 找出怎麼辦纔好雅達從城市黃頁研究所。

sentences.english: The Yellow Pages is all I need.
sentences.chinese: 我需要的僅僅是個黃頁。

sentences.english: Go to the internet or the Yellow Pages.
sentences.chinese: 上網搜搜，或者查查電話黃頁。

sentences.english: The New Haven Telephone Company publishes the first telephone directory.
sentences.chinese: 新海文電話公司出版第一本電話黃頁。

sentences.english: Most of that search can be done at home online or through the yellow pages.
sentences.chinese: 這方面的調查大多可以通過上網或是電話黃頁完成。

sentences.english: Write a yellow pages ad that looks like a blog post.
sentences.chinese: 編寫一個像博客帖子的黃頁廣告。

sentences.english: List of Criminal Defense Lawyers in Tacoma p Yellow Pages.
sentences.chinese: 目錄塔科馬刑事辯護律師在西澳黃頁。

sentences.english: Yellow Pages ads resemble no other kind of advertising.
sentences.chinese: 黃頁廣告不像任何其他類型的廣告。

sentences.english: Businesses and professional services are listed in a special classified directory-the Yellow Pages.
sentences.chinese: 黃頁是商業和專業機構的分類電話號碼。

definition: lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
